item.title: Fitting a simple hierarchical model in R using Template Model Builder
item.description: Introduction This is an example of how to fit a simple hierarchical model in R using Template Model Builder (TMB). I’ll describe why you might want to use a hierarchical model, then I’ll show how to code it up and fit it in TMB. I won’t go too deep into the mechanics of TMB (full documentation can be found here), instead I’ll focus on introducing the idea of hierarchical modelling and how to fit one such model in TMB.

Postdoctoral Research Associate Population Dynamics Branch Northeast Fisheries Science Center, NMFS, NOAA Woods Hole, MA I use statistical models to study why fish populations fluctuate in abundance and distribution. I am particularly interested in research that impacts the management of wild fisheries. Some topics I have worked on: Spatio-temporal modelling of fish distributions Stock assessment methods Ecological forecasting State-space models Time series analysis A list of my publications can be found in my CV.
